summary.long: Joshua is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: Now after the death of Moses the servant of Yahweh, Yahweh spoke to Joshua the son of Nun, Moses’ servant, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Moses my servant is dead. Now therefore arise, go across this Jordan, you and all these people, to the land which I am giving to them, even to the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have given you every place that the sole of your foot will tread on, as I told Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the wilderness and this Lebanon even to the great river, the river Euphrates, all the land of the Hittites, and to the great sea toward the going down of the sun, shall be your border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No man will be able to stand before you all the days of your life. As I was with Moses, so I will be with you. I will not fail you nor forsake you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Be strong and courageous; for you shall cause this people to inherit the land which I swore to their fathers to give them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only be strong and very courageous. Be careful to observe to do according to all the law which Moses my servant commanded you. Don’t turn from it to the right hand or to the left, that you may have good success wherever you go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This book of the law shall not depart from your mouth, but you shall meditate on it day and night, that you may observe to do according to all that is written in it; for then you shall make your way prosperous, and then you shall have good success.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Haven’t I commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Don’t be afraid. Don’t be dismayed, for Yahweh your God is with you wherever you go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua commanded the officers of the people, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Pass through the middle of the camp, and command the people, saying, ‘Prepare food; for within three days you are to pass over this Jordan, to go in to possess the land which Yahweh your God gives you to possess.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua spoke to the Reubenites, and to the Gadites, and to the half-tribe of Manasseh, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Remember the word which Moses the servant of Yahweh commanded you, saying, ‘Yahweh your God gives you rest, and will give you this land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your wives, your little ones, and your livestock shall live in the land which Moses gave you beyond the Jordan; but you shall pass over before your brothers armed, all the mighty men of valor, and shall help them
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until Yahweh has given your brothers rest, as he has given you, and they have also possessed the land which Yahweh your God gives them. Then you shall return to the land of your possession and possess it, which Moses the servant of Yahweh gave you beyond the Jordan toward the sunrise.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered Joshua, saying, “All that you have commanded us we will do, and wherever you send us we will go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as we listened to Moses in all things, so will we listen to you. Only may Yahweh your God be with you, as he was with Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever rebels against your commandment, and doesn’t listen to your words in all that you command him shall himself be put to death. Only be strong and courageous.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua the son of Nun secretly sent two men out of Shittim as spies, saying, “Go, view the land, including Jericho.” They went and came into the house of a prostitute whose name was Rahab, and slept there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king of Jericho was told, “Behold, men of the children of Israel came in here tonight to spy out the land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jericho’s king sent to Rahab, saying, “Bring out the men who have come to you, who have entered into your house; for they have come to spy out all the land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman took the two men and hid them. Then she said, “Yes, the men came to me, but I didn’t know where they came from.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About the time of the shutting of the gate, when it was dark, the men went out. Where the men went, I don’t know. Pursue them quickly. You may catch up with them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But she had brought them up to the roof, and hidden them under the stalks of flax which she had laid in order on the roof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men pursued them along the way to the fords of the Jordan River. As soon as those who pursued them had gone out, they shut the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before they had lain down, she came up to them on the roof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said to the men, “I know that Yahweh has given you the land, and that the fear of you has fallen upon us, and that all the inhabitants of the land melt away before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we have heard how Yahweh dried up the water of the Red Sea before you, when you came out of Egypt; and what you did to the two kings of the Amorites, who were beyond the Jordan, to Sihon and to Og, whom you utterly destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as we had heard it, our hearts melted, and there wasn’t any more spirit in any man, because of you: for Yahweh your God, he is God in heaven above, and on earth beneath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, please swear to me by Yahweh, since I have dealt kindly with you, that you also will deal kindly with my father’s house, and give me a true sign;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that you will save alive my father, my mother, my brothers, and my sisters, and all that they have, and will deliver our lives from death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men said to her, “Our life for yours, if you don’t talk about this business of ours; and it shall be, when Yahweh gives us the land, that we will deal kindly and truly with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she let them down by a cord through the window; for her house was on the side of the wall, and she lived on the wall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said to them, “Go to the mountain, lest the pursuers find you. Hide yourselves there three days, until the pursuers have returned. Afterward, you may go your way.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men said to her, “We will be guiltless of this your oath which you’ve made us to swear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, when we come into the land, tie this line of scarlet thread in the window which you used to let us down. Gather to yourself into the house your father, your mother, your brothers, and all your father’s household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be that whoever goes out of the doors of your house into the street, his blood will be on his head, and we will be guiltless. Whoever is with you in the house, his blood shall be on our head, if any hand is on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you talk about this business of ours, then we shall be guiltless of your oath which you’ve made us to swear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said, “Let it be as you have said.” She sent them away, and they departed. Then she tied the scarlet line in the window.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went and came to the mountain, and stayed there three days, until the pursuers had returned. The pursuers sought them all along the way, but didn’t find them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the two men returned, descended from the mountain, crossed the river, and came to Joshua the son of Nun. They told him all that had happened to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to Joshua, “Truly Yahweh has delivered all the land into our hands. Moreover, all the inhabitants of the land melt away before us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua got up early in the morning; and they moved from Shittim and came to the Jordan, he and all the children of Israel. They camped there before they crossed over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After three days, the officers went through the middle of the camp;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they commanded the people, saying, “When you see the ark of Yahweh your God’s covenant, and the Levitical priests bearing it, then leave your place and follow it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet there shall be a space between you and it of about two thousand cubits by measure—don’t come closer to it—that you may know the way by which you must go; for you have not passed this way before.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said to the people, “Sanctify yourselves; for tomorrow Yahweh will do wonders among you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua spoke to the priests, saying, “Take up the ark of the covenant, and cross over before the people.” They took up the ark of the covenant, and went before the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Joshua, “Today I will begin to magnify you in the sight of all Israel, that they may know that as I was with Moses, so I will be with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall command the priests who bear the ark of the covenant, saying, ‘When you come to the brink of the waters of the Jordan, you shall stand still in the Jordan.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said to the children of Israel, “Come here, and hear the words of Yahweh your God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said, “By this you shall know that the living God is among you, and that he will without fail drive the Canaanite, the Hittite, the Hivite, the Perizzite, the Girgashite, the Amorite, and the Jebusite out from before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, the ark of the covenant of the Lord of all the earth passes over before you into the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore take twelve men out of the tribes of Israel, for every tribe a man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be that when the soles of the feet of the priests who bear the ark of Yahweh, the Lord of all the earth, rest in the waters of the Jordan, that the waters of the Jordan will be cut off. The waters that come down from above shall stand in one heap.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the people moved from their tents to pass over the Jordan, the priests who bore the ark of the covenant being before the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when those who bore the ark had come to the Jordan, and the feet of the priests who bore the ark had dipped in the edge of the water (for the Jordan overflows all its banks all the time of harvest),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the waters which came down from above stood, and rose up in one heap a great way off, at Adam, the city that is beside Zarethan; and those that went down toward the sea of the Arabah, even the Salt Sea, were wholly cut off. Then the people passed over near Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priests who bore the ark of Yahweh’s covenant stood firm on dry ground in the middle of the Jordan; and all Israel crossed over on dry ground, until all the nation had passed completely over the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the nation had completely crossed over the Jordan, Yahweh spoke to Joshua, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take twelve men out of the people, a man out of every tribe,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and command them, saying, ‘Take from out of the middle of the Jordan, out of the place where the priests’ feet stood firm, twelve stones, carry them over with you, and lay them down in the place where you’ll camp tonight.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua called the twelve men whom he had prepared of the children of Israel, a man out of every tribe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said to them, “Cross before the ark of Yahweh your God into the middle of the Jordan, and each of you pick up a stone and put it on your shoulder, according to the number of the tribes of the children of Israel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that this may be a sign among you, that when your children ask in the future, saying, ‘What do you mean by these stones?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you shall tell them, ‘Because the waters of the Jordan were cut off before the ark of Yahweh’s covenant. When it crossed over the Jordan, the waters of the Jordan were cut off. These stones shall be for a memorial to the children of Israel forever.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel did as Joshua commanded, and took up twelve stones out of the middle of the Jordan, as Yahweh spoke to Joshua, according to the number of the tribes of the children of Israel. They carried them over with them to the place where they camped, and laid them down there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua set up twelve stones in the middle of the Jordan, in the place where the feet of the priests who bore the ark of the covenant stood; and they are there to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the priests who bore the ark stood in the middle of the Jordan until everything was finished that Yahweh commanded Joshua to speak to the people, according to all that Moses commanded Joshua; and the people hurried and passed over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the people had completely crossed over, Yahweh’s ark crossed over with the priests in the presence of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Reuben, and the children of Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh crossed over armed before the children of Israel, as Moses spoke to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About forty thousand men, ready and armed for war, passed over before Yahweh to battle, to the plains of Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day, Yahweh magnified Joshua in the sight of all Israel; and they feared him, as they feared Moses, all the days of his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Joshua, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Command the priests who bear the ark of the covenant, that they come up out of the Jordan.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua therefore commanded the priests, saying, “Come up out of the Jordan!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the priests who bore the ark of Yahweh’s covenant had come up out of the middle of the Jordan, and the soles of the priests’ feet had been lifted up to the dry ground, the waters of the Jordan returned to their place, and went over all its banks, as before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people came up out of the Jordan on the tenth day of the first month, and encamped in Gilgal, on the east border of Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua set up those twelve stones, which they took out of the Jordan, in Gilgal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke to the children of Israel, saying, “When your children ask their fathers in time to come, saying, ‘What do these stones mean?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall let your children know, saying, ‘Israel came over this Jordan on dry land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Yahweh your God dried up the waters of the Jordan from before you until you had crossed over, as Yahweh your God did to the Red Sea, which he dried up from before us, until we had crossed over,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that all the peoples of the earth may know that Yahweh’s hand is mighty, and that you may fear Yahweh your God forever.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the kings of the Amorites, who were beyond the Jordan westward, and all the kings of the Canaanites, who were by the sea, heard how Yahweh had dried up the waters of the Jordan from before the children of Israel until we had crossed over, their heart melted, and there was no more spirit in them, because of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time, Yahweh said to Joshua, “Make flint knives, and circumcise again the sons of Israel the second time.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua made himself flint knives, and circumcised the sons of Israel at the hill of the foreskins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the reason Joshua circumcised them: all the people who came out of Egypt, who were males, even all the men of war, died in the wilderness along the way, after they came out of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all the people who came out were circumcised; but all the people who were born in the wilderness along the way as they came out of Egypt had not been circumcised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the children of Israel walked forty years in the wilderness until all the nation, even the men of war who came out of Egypt, were consumed, because they didn’t listen to Yahweh’s voice. Yahweh swore to them that he wouldn’t let them see the land which Yahweh swore to their fathers that he would give us, a land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their children, whom he raised up in their place, were circumcised by Joshua, for they were uncircumcised, because they had not circumcised them on the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they were done circumcising the whole nation, they stayed in their places in the camp until they were healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Joshua, “Today I have rolled away the reproach of Egypt from you.” Therefore the name of that place was called Gilgal to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel encamped in Gilgal. They kept the Passover on the fourteenth day of the month at evening in the plains of Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They ate unleavened cakes and parched grain of the produce of the land on the next day after the Passover, in the same day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The manna ceased on the next day, after they had eaten of the produce of the land. The children of Israel didn’t have manna any more, but they ate of the fruit of the land of Canaan that year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joshua was by Jericho, he lifted up his eyes and looked, and behold, a man stood in front of him with his sword drawn in his hand. Joshua went to him and said to him, “Are you for us, or for our enemies?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said, “No; but I have come now as commander of Yahweh’s army.”
Joshua fell on his face to the earth, and worshiped, and asked him, “What does my lord say to his servant?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The prince of Yahweh’s army said to Joshua, “Take off your sandals, for the place on which you stand is holy.” Joshua did so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jericho was tightly shut up because of the children of Israel. No one went out, and no one came in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Joshua, “Behold, I have given Jericho into your hand, with its king and the mighty men of valor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of your men of war shall march around the city, going around the city once. You shall do this six days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven priests shall bear seven trumpets of rams’ horns before the ark. On the seventh day, you shall march around the city seven times, and the priests shall blow the trumpets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be that when they make a long blast with the ram’s horn, and when you hear the sound of the trumpet, all the people shall shout with a great shout; then the city wall will fall down flat, and the people shall go up, every man straight in front of him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua the son of Nun called the priests, and said to them, “Take up the ark of the covenant, and let seven priests bear seven trumpets of rams’ horns before Yahweh’s ark.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to the people, “Advance! March around the city, and let the armed men pass on before Yahweh’s ark.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was so, that when Joshua had spoken to the people, the seven priests bearing the seven trumpets of rams’ horns before Yahweh advanced and blew the trumpets, and the ark of Yahweh’s covenant followed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The armed men went before the priests who blew the trumpets, and the ark went after them. The trumpets sounded as they went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua commanded the people, saying, “You shall not shout nor let your voice be heard, neither shall any word proceed out of your mouth until the day I tell you to shout. Then you shall shout.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he caused Yahweh’s ark to go around the city, circling it once. Then they came into the camp, and stayed in the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua rose early in the morning, and the priests took up Yahweh’s ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seven priests bearing the seven trumpets of rams’ horns in front of Yahweh’s ark went on continually, and blew the trumpets. The armed men went in front of them. The rear guard came after Yahweh’s ark. The trumpets sounded as they went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second day they marched around the city once, and returned into the camp. They did this six days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the seventh day, they rose early at the dawning of the day, and marched around the city in the same way seven times. On this day only they marched around the city seven times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the seventh time, when the priests blew the trumpets, Joshua said to the people, “Shout, for Yahweh has given you the city!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The city shall be devoted, even it and all that is in it, to Yahweh. Only Rahab the prostitute shall live, she and all who are with her in the house, because she hid the messengers that we sent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for you, only keep yourselves from what is devoted to destruction, lest when you have devoted it, you take of the devoted thing; so you would make the camp of Israel accursed and trouble it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all the silver, gold, and vessels of bronze and iron are holy to Yahweh. They shall come into Yahweh’s treasury.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people shouted and the priests blew the trumpets. When the people heard the sound of the trumpet, the people shouted with a great shout, and the wall fell down flat, so that the people went up into the city, every man straight in front of him, and they took the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They utterly destroyed all that was in the city, both man and woman, both young and old, and ox, sheep, and donkey, with the edge of the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said to the two men who had spied out the land, “Go into the prostitute’s house, and bring the woman and all that she has out from there, as you swore to her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The young men who were spies went in, and brought out Rahab with her father, her mother, her brothers, and all that she had. They also brought out all of her relatives, and they set them outside of the camp of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They burned the city with fire, and all that was in it. Only they put the silver, the gold, and the vessels of bronze and of iron into the treasury of Yahweh’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Rahab the prostitute, her father’s household, and all that she had, Joshua saved alive. She lives in the middle of Israel to this day, because she hid the messengers whom Joshua sent to spy out Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua commanded them with an oath at that time, saying, “Cursed is the man before Yahweh who rises up and builds this city Jericho. With the loss of his firstborn he will lay its foundation, and with the loss of his youngest son he will set up its gates.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Yahweh was with Joshua; and his fame was in all the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the children of Israel committed a trespass in the devoted things; for Achan, the son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, took some of the devoted things. Therefore Yahweh’s anger burned against the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Joshua sent men from Jericho to Ai, which is beside Beth Aven, on the east side of Bethel, and spoke to them, saying, “Go up and spy out the land.”
The men went up and spied out Ai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They returned to Joshua, and said to him, “Don’t let all the people go up, but let about two or three thousand men go up and strike Ai. Don’t make all the people to toil there, for there are only a few of them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So about three thousand men of the people went up there, and they fled before the men of Ai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Ai struck about thirty-six men of them. They chased them from before the gate even to Shebarim, and struck them at the descent. The hearts of the people melted, and became like water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua tore his clothes, and fell to the earth on his face before Yahweh’s ark until the evening, he and the elders of Israel; and they put dust on their heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said, “Alas, Lord Yahweh, why have you brought this people over the Jordan at all, to deliver us into the hand of the Amorites, to cause us to perish? I wish that we had been content and lived beyond the Jordan!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Oh, Lord, what shall I say, after Israel has turned their backs before their enemies?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Canaanites and all the inhabitants of the land will hear of it, and will surround us, and cut off our name from the earth. What will you do for your great name?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Joshua, “Get up! Why have you fallen on your face like that?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel has sinned. Yes, they have even transgressed my covenant which I commanded them. Yes, they have even taken some of the devoted things, and have also stolen, and also deceived. They have even put it among their own stuff.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the children of Israel can’t stand before their enemies. They turn their backs before their enemies, because they have become devoted for destruction. I will not be with you any more, unless you destroy the devoted things from among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Get up! Sanctify the people, and say, ‘Sanctify yourselves for tomorrow, for Yahweh, the God of Israel, says, “There is a devoted thing among you, Israel. You cannot stand before your enemies until you take away the devoted thing from among you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the morning therefore you shall be brought near by your tribes. It shall be that the tribe which Yahweh selects shall come near by families. The family which Yahweh selects shall come near by households. The household which Yahweh selects shall come near man by man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be, that he who is taken with the devoted thing shall be burned with fire, he and all that he has, because he has transgressed Yahweh’s covenant, and because he has done a disgraceful thing in Israel.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua rose up early in the morning and brought Israel near by their tribes. The tribe of Judah was selected.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought near the family of Judah, and he selected the family of the Zerahites. He brought near the family of the Zerahites man by man, and Zabdi was selected.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought near his household man by man, and Achan, the son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, was selected.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said to Achan, “My son, please give glory to Yahweh, the God of Israel, and make confession to him. Tell me now what you have done! Don’t hide it from me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Achan answered Joshua, and said, “I have truly sinned against Yahweh, the God of Israel, and this is what I have done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I saw among the plunder a beautiful Babylonian robe, two hundred shekels of silver, and a wedge of gold weighing fifty shekels, then I coveted them and took them. Behold, they are hidden in the ground in the middle of my tent, with the silver under it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua sent messengers, and they ran to the tent. Behold, it was hidden in his tent, with the silver under it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took them from the middle of the tent, and brought them to Joshua and to all the children of Israel. They laid them down before Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua, and all Israel with him, took Achan the son of Zerah, the silver, the robe, the wedge of gold, his sons, his daughters, his cattle, his donkeys, his sheep, his tent, and all that he had; and they brought them up to the valley of Achor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said, “Why have you troubled us? Yahweh will trouble you today.” All Israel stoned him with stones, and they burned them with fire and stoned them with stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They raised over him a great heap of stones that remains to this day. Yahweh turned from the fierceness of his anger. Therefore the name of that place was called “The valley of Achor” to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Joshua, “Don’t be afraid, and don’t be dismayed. Take all the warriors with you, and arise, go up to Ai. Behold, I have given into your hand the king of Ai, with his people, his city, and his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall do to Ai and her king as you did to Jericho and her king, except you shall take its goods and its livestock for yourselves. Set an ambush for the city behind it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua arose, with all the warriors, to go up to Ai. Joshua chose thirty thousand men, the mighty men of valor, and sent them out by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He commanded them, saying, “Behold, you shall lie in ambush against the city, behind the city. Don’t go very far from the city, but all of you be ready.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I and all the people who are with me will approach the city. It shall happen, when they come out against us, as at the first, that we will flee before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will come out after us until we have drawn them away from the city; for they will say, ‘They flee before us, like the first time.’ So we will flee before them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you shall rise up from the ambush, and take possession of the city; for Yahweh your God will deliver it into your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be, when you have seized the city, that you shall set the city on fire. You shall do this according to Yahweh’s word. Behold, I have commanded you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua sent them out; and they went to set up the ambush, and stayed between Bethel and Ai on the west side of Ai; but Joshua stayed among the people that night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua rose up early in the morning, mustered the people, and went up, he and the elders of Israel, before the people to Ai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people, even the men of war who were with him, went up and came near, and came before the city and encamped on the north side of Ai. Now there was a valley between him and Ai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took about five thousand men, and set them in ambush between Bethel and Ai, on the west side of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they set the people, even all the army who was on the north of the city, and their ambush on the west of the city; and Joshua went that night into the middle of the valley.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the king of Ai saw it, they hurried and rose up early, and the men of the city went out against Israel to battle, he and all his people, at the time appointed, before the Arabah; but he didn’t know that there was an ambush against him behind the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua and all Israel made as if they were beaten before them, and fled by the way of the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people who were in the city were called together to pursue after them. They pursued Joshua, and were drawn away from the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was not a man left in Ai or Bethel who didn’t go out after Israel. They left the city open, and pursued Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh said to Joshua, “Stretch out the javelin that is in your hand toward Ai, for I will give it into your hand.”
Joshua stretched out the javelin that was in his hand toward the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ambush arose quickly out of their place, and they ran as soon as he had stretched out his hand and entered into the city and took it. They hurried and set the city on fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the men of Ai looked behind them, they saw, and behold, the smoke of the city ascended up to heaven, and they had no power to flee this way or that way. The people who fled to the wilderness turned back on the pursuers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joshua and all Israel saw that the ambush had taken the city, and that the smoke of the city ascended, then they turned back and killed the men of Ai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The others came out of the city against them, so they were in the middle of Israel, some on this side, and some on that side. They struck them, so that they let none of them remain or escape.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They captured the king of Ai alive, and brought him to Joshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Israel had finished killing all the inhabitants of Ai in the field, in the wilderness in which they pursued them, and they had all fallen by the edge of the sword until they were consumed, all Israel returned to Ai and struck it with the edge of the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All that fell that day, both of men and women, were twelve thousand, even all the people of Ai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Joshua didn’t draw back his hand, with which he stretched out the javelin, until he had utterly destroyed all the inhabitants of Ai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel took for themselves only the livestock and the goods of that city, according to Yahweh’s word which he commanded Joshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua burned Ai and made it a heap forever, even a desolation, to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hanged the king of Ai on a tree until the evening. At sundown, Joshua commanded, and they took his body down from the tree and threw it at the entrance of the gate of the city, and raised a great heap of stones on it that remains to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua built an altar to Yahweh, the God of Israel, on Mount Ebal,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as Moses the servant of Yahweh commanded the children of Israel, as it is written in the book of the law of Moses: an altar of uncut stones, on which no one had lifted up any iron. They offered burnt offerings on it to Yahweh and sacrificed peace offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He wrote there on the stones a copy of Moses’ law, which he wrote in the presence of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All Israel, with their elders, officers, and judges, stood on both sides of the ark before the Levitical priests, who carried the ark of Yahweh’s covenant, the foreigner as well as the native; half of them in front of Mount Gerizim, and half of them in front of Mount Ebal, as Moses the servant of Yahweh had commanded at the first, that they should bless the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward he read all the words of the law, the blessing and the curse, according to all that is written in the book of the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was not a word of all that Moses commanded which Joshua didn’t read before all the assembly of Israel, with the women, the little ones, and the foreigners who were among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the kings who were beyond the Jordan, in the hill country, and in the lowland, and on all the shore of the great sea in front of Lebanon, the Hittite, the Amorite, the Canaanite, the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite, heard of it
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they gathered themselves together to fight with Joshua and with Israel, with one accord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the inhabitants of Gibeon heard what Joshua had done to Jericho and to Ai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they also resorted to a ruse, and went and made as if they had been ambassadors, and took old sacks on their donkeys, and old, torn-up and bound up wineskins,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and old and patched sandals on their feet, and wore old garments. All the bread of their food supply was dry and moldy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went to Joshua at the camp at Gilgal, and said to him and to the men of Israel, “We have come from a far country. Now therefore make a covenant with us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Israel said to the Hivites, “What if you live among us? How could we make a covenant with you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They said to Joshua, “We are your servants.”
Joshua said to them, “Who are you? Where do you come from?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “Your servants have come from a very far country because of the name of Yahweh your God; for we have heard of his fame, all that he did in Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all that he did to the two kings of the Amorites who were beyond the Jordan, to Sihon king of Heshbon and to Og king of Bashan, who was at Ashtaroth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our elders and all the inhabitants of our country spoke to us, saying, ‘Take supplies in your hand for the journey, and go to meet them. Tell them, “We are your servants. Now make a covenant with us.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This our bread we took hot for our supplies out of our houses on the day we went out to go to you; but now, behold, it is dry, and has become moldy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These wineskins, which we filled, were new; and behold, they are torn. These our garments and our sandals have become old because of the very long journey.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men sampled their provisions, and didn’t ask counsel from Yahweh’s mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua made peace with them, and made a covenant with them, to let them live. The princes of the congregation swore to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the end of three days after they had made a covenant with them, they heard that they were their neighbors, and that they lived among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel traveled and came to their cities on the third day. Now their cities were Gibeon, Chephirah, Beeroth, and Kiriath Jearim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel didn’t strike them, because the princes of the congregation had sworn to them by Yahweh, the God of Israel. All the congregation murmured against the princes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all the princes said to all the congregation, “We have sworn to them by Yahweh, the God of Israel. Now therefore we may not touch them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We will do this to them, and let them live; lest wrath be on us, because of the oath which we swore to them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The princes said to them, “Let them live.” So they became wood cutters and drawers of water for all the congregation, as the princes had spoken to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua called for them, and he spoke to them, saying, “Why have you deceived us, saying, ‘We are very far from you,’ when you live among us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore you are cursed, and some of you will never fail to be slaves, both wood cutters and drawers of water for the house of my God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered Joshua, and said, “Because your servants were certainly told how Yahweh your God commanded his servant Moses to give you all the land, and to destroy all the inhabitants of the land from before you. Therefore we were very afraid for our lives because of you, and have done this thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, behold, we are in your hand. Do to us as it seems good and right to you to do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did so to them, and delivered them out of the hand of the children of Israel, so that they didn’t kill them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That day Joshua made them wood cutters and drawers of water for the congregation and for Yahweh’s altar to this day, in the place which he should choose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Adoni-Zedek king of Jerusalem heard how Joshua had taken Ai, and had utterly destroyed it; as he had done to Jericho and her king, so he had done to Ai and her king; and how the inhabitants of Gibeon had made peace with Israel, and were among them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they were very afraid, because Gibeon was a great city, as one of the royal cities, and because it was greater than Ai, and all its men were mighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Adoni-Zedek king of Jerusalem sent to Hoham king of Hebron, Piram king of Jarmuth, Japhia king of Lachish, and Debir king of Eglon, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Come up to me and help me. Let’s strike Gibeon; for they have made peace with Joshua and with the children of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the five kings of the Amorites, the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon, gathered themselves together and went up, they and all their armies, and encamped against Gibeon, and made war against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Gibeon sent to Joshua at the camp at Gilgal, saying, “Don’t abandon your servants! Come up to us quickly and save us! Help us; for all the kings of the Amorites that dwell in the hill country have gathered together against us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua went up from Gilgal, he and the whole army with him, including all the mighty men of valor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Joshua, “Don’t fear them, for I have delivered them into your hands. Not a man of them will stand before you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua therefore came to them suddenly. He marched from Gilgal all night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh confused them before Israel. He killed them with a great slaughter at Gibeon, and chased them by the way of the ascent of Beth Horon, and struck them to Azekah and to Makkedah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they fled from before Israel, while they were at the descent of Beth Horon, Yahweh hurled down great stones from the sky on them to Azekah, and they died. There were more who died from the hailstones than those whom the children of Israel killed with the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua spoke to Yahweh in the day when Yahweh delivered up the Amorites before the children of Israel. He said in the sight of Israel, “Sun, stand still on Gibeon! You, moon, stop in the valley of Aijalon!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sun stood still, and the moon stayed, until the nation had avenged themselves of their enemies. Isn’t this written in the book of Jashar? The sun stayed in the middle of the sky, and didn’t hurry to go down about a whole day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was no day like that before it or after it, that Yahweh listened to the voice of a man; for Yahweh fought for Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua returned, and all Israel with him, to the camp to Gilgal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These five kings fled, and hid themselves in the cave at Makkedah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua was told, saying, “The five kings have been found, hidden in the cave at Makkedah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said, “Roll large stones to cover the cave’s entrance, and set men by it to guard them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but don’t stay there. Pursue your enemies, and attack them from the rear. Don’t allow them to enter into their cities; for Yahweh your God has delivered them into your hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joshua and the children of Israel had finished killing them with a very great slaughter until they were consumed, and the remnant which remained of them had entered into the fortified cities,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the people returned to the camp to Joshua at Makkedah in peace. None moved his tongue against any of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua said, “Open the cave entrance, and bring those five kings out of the cave to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did so, and brought those five kings out of the cave to him: the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When they brought those kings out to Joshua, Joshua called for all the men of Israel, and said to the chiefs of the men of war who went with him, “Come near. Put your feet on the necks of these kings.”
They came near, and put their feet on their necks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said to them, “Don’t be afraid, nor be dismayed. Be strong and courageous, for Yahweh will do this to all your enemies against whom you fight.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward Joshua struck them, put them to death, and hanged them on five trees. They were hanging on the trees until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the time of the going down of the sun, Joshua commanded, and they took them down off the trees, and threw them into the cave in which they had hidden themselves, and laid great stones on the mouth of the cave, which remain to this very day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua took Makkedah on that day, and struck it with the edge of the sword, with its king. He utterly destroyed it and all the souls who were in it. He left no one remaining. He did to the king of Makkedah as he had done to the king of Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua passed from Makkedah, and all Israel with him, to Libnah, and fought against Libnah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh delivered it also, with its king, into the hand of Israel. He struck it with the edge of the sword, and all the souls who were in it. He left no one remaining in it. He did to its king as he had done to the king of Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua passed from Libnah, and all Israel with him, to Lachish, and encamped against it, and fought against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh delivered Lachish into the hand of Israel. He took it on the second day, and struck it with the edge of the sword, with all the souls who were in it, according to all that he had done to Libnah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Horam king of Gezer came up to help Lachish; and Joshua struck him and his people, until he had left him no one remaining.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua passed from Lachish, and all Israel with him, to Eglon; and they encamped against it and fought against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took it on that day, and struck it with the edge of the sword. He utterly destroyed all the souls who were in it that day, according to all that he had done to Lachish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua went up from Eglon, and all Israel with him, to Hebron; and they fought against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took it, and struck it with the edge of the sword, with its king and all its cities, and all the souls who were in it. He left no one remaining, according to all that he had done to Eglon; but he utterly destroyed it, and all the souls who were in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua returned, and all Israel with him, to Debir, and fought against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took it, with its king and all its cities. They struck them with the edge of the sword, and utterly destroyed all the souls who were in it. He left no one remaining. As he had done to Hebron, so he did to Debir, and to its king; as he had done also to Libnah, and to its king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua struck all the land, the hill country, the South, the lowland, the slopes, and all their kings. He left no one remaining, but he utterly destroyed all that breathed, as Yahweh, the God of Israel, commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua struck them from Kadesh Barnea even to Gaza, and all the country of Goshen, even to Gibeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua took all these kings and their land at one time because Yahweh, the God of Israel, fought for Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua returned, and all Israel with him, to the camp to Gilgal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jabin king of Hazor heard of it, he sent to Jobab king of Madon, to the king of Shimron, to the king of Achshaph,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to the kings who were on the north, in the hill country, in the Arabah south of Chinneroth, in the lowland, and in the heights of Dor on the west,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the Canaanite on the east and on the west, the Amorite, the Hittite, the Perizzite, the Jebusite in the hill country, and the Hivite under Hermon in the land of Mizpah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went out, they and all their armies with them, many people, even as the sand that is on the seashore in multitude, with very many horses and chariots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these kings met together; and they came and encamped together at the waters of Merom, to fight with Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Joshua, “Don’t be afraid because of them; for tomorrow at this time, I will deliver them up all slain before Israel. You shall hamstring their horses and burn their chariots with fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua came suddenly, with all the warriors, against them by the waters of Merom, and attacked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh delivered them into the hand of Israel, and they struck them, and chased them to great Sidon, and to Misrephoth Maim, and to the valley of Mizpah eastward. They struck them until they left them no one remaining.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua did to them as Yahweh told him. He hamstrung their horses and burned their chariots with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua turned back at that time, and took Hazor, and struck its king with the sword; for Hazor used to be the head of all those kingdoms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They struck all the souls who were in it with the edge of the sword, utterly destroying them. There was no one left who breathed. He burned Hazor with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua captured all the cities of those kings, with their kings, and he struck them with the edge of the sword, and utterly destroyed them, as Moses the servant of Yahweh commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for the cities that stood on their mounds, Israel burned none of them, except Hazor only. Joshua burned that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel took all the plunder of these cities, with the livestock, as plunder for themselves; but every man they struck with the edge of the sword, until they had destroyed them. They didn’t leave any who breathed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Yahweh commanded Moses his servant, so Moses commanded Joshua. Joshua did so. He left nothing undone of all that Yahweh commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua captured all that land, the hill country, all the South, all the land of Goshen, the lowland, the Arabah, the hill country of Israel, and the lowland of the same,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Mount Halak, that goes up to Seir, even to Baal Gad in the valley of Lebanon under Mount Hermon. He took all their kings, struck them, and put them to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua made war a long time with all those kings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was not a city that made peace with the children of Israel, except the Hivites, the inhabitants of Gibeon. They took all in battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it was of Yahweh to harden their hearts, to come against Israel in battle, that he might utterly destroy them, that they might have no favor, but that he might destroy them, as Yahweh commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua came at that time, and cut off the Anakim from the hill country, from Hebron, from Debir, from Anab, and from all the hill country of Judah, and from all the hill country of Israel. Joshua utterly destroyed them with their cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were none of the Anakim left in the land of the children of Israel. Only in Gaza, in Gath, and in Ashdod, did some remain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua took the whole land, according to all that Yahweh spoke to Moses; and Joshua gave it for an inheritance to Israel according to their divisions by their tribes. Then the land had rest from war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the kings of the land, whom the children of Israel struck, and possessed their land beyond the Jordan toward the sunrise, from the valley of the Arnon to Mount Hermon, and all the Arabah eastward:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon, and ruled from Aroer, which is on the edge of the valley of the Arnon, and the middle of the valley, and half Gilead, even to the river Jabbok, the border of the children of Ammon;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Arabah to the sea of Chinneroth, eastward, and to the sea of the Arabah, even the Salt Sea, eastward, the way to Beth Jeshimoth; and on the south, under the slopes of Pisgah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the border of Og king of Bashan, of the remnant of the Rephaim, who lived at Ashtaroth and at Edrei,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ruled in Mount Hermon, and in Salecah, and in all Bashan, to the border of the Geshurites and the Maacathites, and half Gilead, the border of Sihon king of Heshbon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses the servant of Yahweh and the children of Israel struck them. Moses the servant of Yahweh gave it for a possession to the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the kings of the land whom Joshua and the children of Israel struck beyond the Jordan westward, from Baal Gad in the valley of Lebanon even to Mount Halak, that goes up to Seir. Joshua gave it to the tribes of Israel for a possession according to their divisions;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the hill country, and in the lowland, and in the Arabah, and in the slopes, and in the wilderness, and in the South; the Hittite, the Amorite, and the Canaanite, the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Jericho, one;
the king of Ai, which is beside Bethel, one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Jerusalem, one;
the king of Hebron, one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Jarmuth, one;
the king of Lachish, one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Eglon, one;
the king of Gezer, one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Debir, one;
the king of Geder, one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Hormah, one;
the king of Arad, one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Libnah, one;
the king of Adullam, one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Makkedah, one;
the king of Bethel, one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Tappuah, one;
the king of Hepher, one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Aphek, one;
the king of Lassharon, one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Madon, one;
the king of Hazor, one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Shimron Meron, one;
the king of Achshaph, one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Taanach, one;
the king of Megiddo, one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Kedesh, one;
the king of Jokneam in Carmel, one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Dor in the height of Dor, one;
the king of Goiim in Gilgal, one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Tirzah, one:
all the kings thirty-one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Joshua was old and well advanced in years. Yahweh said to him, “You are old and advanced in years, and there remains yet very much land to be possessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is the land that still remains: all the regions of the Philistines, and all the Geshurites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the Shihor, which is before Egypt, even to the border of Ekron northward, which is counted as Canaanite; the five lords of the Philistines; the Gazites, and the Ashdodites, the Ashkelonites, the Gittites, and the Ekronites; also the Avvim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: on the south; all the land of the Canaanites, and Mearah that belongs to the Sidonians, to Aphek, to the border of the Amorites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the land of the Gebalites, and all Lebanon, toward the sunrise, from Baal Gad under Mount Hermon to the entrance of Hamath;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the inhabitants of the hill country from Lebanon to Misrephoth Maim, even all the Sidonians. I will drive them out from before the children of Israel. Just allocate it to Israel for an inheritance, as I have commanded you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore divide this land for an inheritance to the nine tribes and the half-tribe of Manasseh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With him the Reubenites and the Gadites received their inheritance, which Moses gave them, beyond the Jordan eastward, even as Moses the servant of Yahweh gave them:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Aroer, that is on the edge of the valley of the Arnon, and the city that is in the middle of the valley, and all the plain of Medeba to Dibon;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the cities of Sihon king of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon, to the border of the children of Ammon;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Gilead, and the border of the Geshurites and Maacathites, and all Mount Hermon, and all Bashan to Salecah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the kingdom of Og in Bashan, who reigned in Ashtaroth and in Edrei (who was left of the remnant of the Rephaim); for Moses attacked these, and drove them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless the children of Israel didn’t drive out the Geshurites, nor the Maacathites: but Geshur and Maacath live within Israel to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only he gave no inheritance to the tribe of Levi. The offerings of Yahweh, the God of Israel, made by fire are his inheritance, as he spoke to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses gave to the tribe of the children of Reuben according to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their border was from Aroer, that is on the edge of the valley of the Arnon, and the city that is in the middle of the valley, and all the plain by Medeba;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heshbon, and all its cities that are in the plain; Dibon, Bamoth Baal, Beth Baal Meon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jahaz, Kedemoth, Mephaath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kiriathaim, Sibmah, Zereth Shahar in the mount of the valley,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beth Peor, the slopes of Pisgah, Beth Jeshimoth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the cities of the plain, and all the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon, whom Moses struck with the chiefs of Midian, Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba, the princes of Sihon, who lived in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel also killed Balaam the son of Beor, the soothsayer, with the sword, among the rest of their slain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border of the children of Reuben was the bank of the Jordan. This was the inheritance of the children of Reuben according to their families, the cities and its villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses gave to the tribe of Gad, to the children of Gad, according to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their border was Jazer, and all the cities of Gilead, and half the land of the children of Ammon, to Aroer that is near Rabbah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and from Heshbon to Ramath Mizpeh, and Betonim; and from Mahanaim to the border of Debir;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in the valley, Beth Haram, Beth Nimrah, Succoth, and Zaphon, the rest of the kingdom of Sihon king of Heshbon, the Jordan’s bank, to the uttermost part of the sea of Chinnereth beyond the Jordan eastward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the inheritance of the children of Gad according to their families, the cities and its villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses gave an inheritance to the half-tribe of Manasseh. It was for the half-tribe of the children of Manasseh according to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their border was from Mahanaim, all Bashan, all the kingdom of Og king of Bashan, and all the villages of Jair, which are in Bashan, sixty cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Half Gilead, Ashtaroth, and Edrei, the cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan, were for the children of Machir the son of Manasseh, even for the half of the children of Machir according to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the inheritances which Moses distributed in the plains of Moab, beyond the Jordan at Jericho, eastward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses gave no inheritance to the tribe of Levi. Yahweh, the God of Israel, is their inheritance, as he spoke to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the inheritances which the children of Israel took in the land of Canaan, which Eleazar the priest, Joshua the son of Nun, and the heads of the fathers’ houses of the tribes of the children of Israel, distributed to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by the lot of their inheritance, as Yahweh commanded by Moses, for the nine tribes, and for the half-tribe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Moses had given the inheritance of the two tribes and the half-tribe beyond the Jordan; but to the Levites he gave no inheritance among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the children of Joseph were two tribes, Manasseh and Ephraim. They gave no portion to the Levites in the land, except cities to dwell in, with their pasture lands for their livestock and for their property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel did as Yahweh commanded Moses, and they divided the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the children of Judah came near to Joshua in Gilgal. Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite said to him, “You know the thing that Yahweh spoke to Moses the man of God concerning me and concerning you in Kadesh Barnea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was forty years old when Moses the servant of Yahweh sent me from Kadesh Barnea to spy out the land. I brought him word again as it was in my heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, my brothers who went up with me made the heart of the people melt; but I wholly followed Yahweh my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses swore on that day, saying, ‘Surely the land where you walked shall be an inheritance to you and to your children forever, because you have wholly followed Yahweh my God.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now, behold, Yahweh has kept me alive, as he spoke, these forty-five years, from the time that Yahweh spoke this word to Moses, while Israel walked in the wilderness. Now, behold, I am eighty-five years old, today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As yet I am as strong today as I was in the day that Moses sent me. As my strength was then, even so is my strength now for war, to go out and to come in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore give me this hill country, of which Yahweh spoke in that day; for you heard in that day how the Anakim were there, and great and fortified cities. It may be that Yahweh will be with me, and I shall drive them out, as Yahweh said.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua blessed him; and he gave Hebron to Caleb the son of Jephunneh for an inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Hebron became the inheritance of Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite to this day, because he followed Yahweh, the God of Israel wholeheartedly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the name of Hebron before was Kiriath Arba, after the greatest man among the Anakim. Then the land had rest from war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lot for the tribe of the children of Judah according to their families was to the border of Edom, even to the wilderness of Zin southward, at the uttermost part of the south.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their south border was from the uttermost part of the Salt Sea, from the bay that looks southward;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it went out southward of the ascent of Akrabbim, and passed along to Zin, and went up by the south of Kadesh Barnea, and passed along by Hezron, went up to Addar, and turned toward Karka;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it passed along to Azmon, went out at the brook of Egypt; and the border ended at the sea. This shall be your south border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The east border was the Salt Sea, even to the end of the Jordan. The border of the north quarter was from the bay of the sea at the end of the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border went up to Beth Hoglah, and passed along by the north of Beth Arabah; and the border went up to the stone of Bohan the son of Reuben.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border went up to Debir from the valley of Achor, and so northward, looking toward Gilgal, that faces the ascent of Adummim, which is on the south side of the river. The border passed along to the waters of En Shemesh, and ended at En Rogel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border went up by the valley of the son of Hinnom to the side of the Jebusite (also called Jerusalem) southward; and the border went up to the top of the mountain that lies before the valley of Hinnom westward, which is at the farthest part of the valley of Rephaim northward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border extended from the top of the mountain to the spring of the waters of Nephtoah, and went out to the cities of Mount Ephron; and the border extended to Baalah (also called Kiriath Jearim);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the border turned about from Baalah westward to Mount Seir, and passed along to the side of Mount Jearim (also called Chesalon) on the north, and went down to Beth Shemesh, and passed along by Timnah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the border went out to the side of Ekron northward; and the border extended to Shikkeron, and passed along to Mount Baalah, and went out at Jabneel; and the goings out of the border were at the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The west border was to the shore of the great sea. This is the border of the children of Judah according to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave to Caleb the son of Jephunneh a portion among the children of Judah, according to the commandment of Yahweh to Joshua, even Kiriath Arba, named after the father of Anak (also called Hebron).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Caleb drove out the three sons of Anak: Sheshai, and Ahiman, and Talmai, the children of Anak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went up against the inhabitants of Debir: now the name of Debir before was Kiriath Sepher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Caleb said, “He who strikes Kiriath Sepher, and takes it, to him I will give Achsah my daughter as wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Othniel the son of Kenaz, the brother of Caleb, took it: and he gave him Achsah his daughter as wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she came, she had him ask her father for a field. She got off her donkey, and Caleb said, “What do you want?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She said, “Give me a blessing. Because you have set me in the land of the South, give me also springs of water.”
So he gave her the upper springs and the lower springs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Judah according to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The farthest cities of the tribe of the children of Judah toward the border of Edom in the South were Kabzeel, Eder, Jagur,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kinah, Dimonah, Adadah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kedesh, Hazor, Ithnan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ziph, Telem, Bealoth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hazor Hadattah, Kerioth Hezron (also called Hazor),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Amam, Shema, Moladah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hazar Gaddah, Heshmon, Beth Pelet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hazar Shual, Beersheba, Biziothiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Baalah, Iim, Ezem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eltolad, Chesil, Hormah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ziklag, Madmannah, Sansannah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lebaoth, Shilhim, Ain, and Rimmon. All the cities are twenty-nine, with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the lowland, Eshtaol, Zorah, Ashnah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zanoah, En Gannim, Tappuah, Enam,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jarmuth, Adullam, Socoh, Azekah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shaaraim, Adithaim and Gederah (or Gederothaim); fourteen cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zenan, Hadashah, Migdal Gad,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dilean, Mizpah, Joktheel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lachish, Bozkath, Eglon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cabbon, Lahmam, Chitlish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gederoth, Beth Dagon, Naamah, and Makkedah; sixteen cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Libnah, Ether, Ashan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Iphtah, Ashnah, Nezib,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keilah, Achzib, and Mareshah; nine cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ekron, with its towns and its villages;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Ekron even to the sea, all that were by the side of Ashdod, with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ashdod, its towns and its villages; Gaza, its towns and its villages; to the brook of Egypt, and the great sea with its coastline.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the hill country, Shamir, Jattir, Socoh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dannah, Kiriath Sannah (which is Debir),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anab, Eshtemoh, Anim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Goshen, Holon, and Giloh; eleven cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Arab, Dumah, Eshan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Janim, Beth Tappuah, Aphekah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Humtah, Kiriath Arba (also called Hebron), and Zior; nine cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Maon, Carmel, Ziph, Jutah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jezreel, Jokdeam, Zanoah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kain, Gibeah, and Timnah; ten cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Halhul, Beth Zur, Gedor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Maarath, Beth Anoth, and Eltekon; six cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kiriath Baal (also called Kiriath Jearim), and Rabbah; two cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the wilderness, Beth Arabah, Middin, Secacah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nibshan, the City of Salt, and En Gedi; six cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the Jebusites, the inhabitants of Jerusalem, the children of Judah couldn’t drive them out; but the Jebusites live with the children of Judah at Jerusalem to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lot came out for the children of Joseph from the Jordan at Jericho, at the waters of Jericho on the east, even the wilderness, going up from Jericho through the hill country to Bethel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It went out from Bethel to Luz, and passed along to the border of the Archites to Ataroth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it went down westward to the border of the Japhletites, to the border of Beth Horon the lower, and on to Gezer; and ended at the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Joseph, Manasseh and Ephraim, took their inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the border of the children of Ephraim according to their families. The border of their inheritance eastward was Ataroth Addar, to Beth Horon the upper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border went out westward at Michmethath on the north. The border turned about eastward to Taanath Shiloh, and passed along it on the east of Janoah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It went down from Janoah to Ataroth, to Naarah, reached to Jericho, and went out at the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Tappuah the border went along westward to the brook of Kanah; and ended at the sea. This is the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Ephraim according to their families;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: together with the cities which were set apart for the children of Ephraim in the middle of the inheritance of the children of Manasseh, all the cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They didn’t drive out the Canaanites who lived in Gezer; but the Canaanites dwell in the territory of Ephraim to this day, and have become servants to do forced labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the lot for the tribe of Manasseh, for he was the firstborn of Joseph. As for Machir the firstborn of Manasseh, the father of Gilead, because he was a man of war, therefore he had Gilead and Bashan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So this was for the rest of the children of Manasseh according to their families: for the children of Abiezer, for the children of Helek, for the children of Asriel, for the children of Shechem, for the children of Hepher, and for the children of Shemida. These were the male children of Manasseh the son of Joseph according to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, had no sons, but daughters. These are the names of his daughters: Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to Eleazar the priest, and to Joshua the son of Nun, and to the princes, saying, “Yahweh commanded Moses to give us an inheritance among our brothers.” Therefore according to the commandment of Yahweh he gave them an inheritance among the brothers of their father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ten parts fell to Manasseh, in addition to the land of Gilead and Bashan, which is beyond the Jordan;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the daughters of Manasseh had an inheritance among his sons. The land of Gilead belonged to the rest of the sons of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border of Manasseh was from Asher to Michmethath, which is before Shechem. The border went along to the right hand, to the inhabitants of En Tappuah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The land of Tappuah belonged to Manasseh; but Tappuah on the border of Manasseh belonged to the children of Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border went down to the brook of Kanah, southward of the brook. These cities belonged to Ephraim among the cities of Manasseh. The border of Manasseh was on the north side of the brook, and ended at the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Southward it was Ephraim’s, and northward it was Manasseh’s, and the sea was his border. They reached to Asher on the north, and to Issachar on the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Manasseh had three heights in Issachar, in Asher Beth Shean and its towns, and Ibleam and its towns, and the inhabitants of Dor and its towns, and the inhabitants of Endor and its towns, and the inhabitants of Taanach and its towns, and the inhabitants of Megiddo and its towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet the children of Manasseh couldn’t drive out the inhabitants of those cities; but the Canaanites would dwell in that land.
verses.speaker: Narrator
