verses.text: When the children of Israel had grown strong, they put the Canaanites to forced labor, and didn’t utterly drive them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Joseph spoke to Joshua, saying, “Why have you given me just one lot and one part for an inheritance, since we are a numerous people, because Yahweh has blessed us so far?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said to them, “If you are a numerous people, go up to the forest, and clear land for yourself there in the land of the Perizzites and of the Rephaim, since the hill country of Ephraim is too narrow for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Joseph said, “The hill country is not enough for us. All the Canaanites who dwell in the land of the valley have chariots of iron, both those who are in Beth Shean and its towns, and those who are in the valley of Jezreel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua spoke to the house of Joseph, that is, to Ephraim and to Manasseh, saying, “You are a numerous people, and have great power. You shall not have one lot only;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the hill country shall be yours. Although it is a forest, you shall cut it down, and it’s farthest extent shall be yours; for you shall drive out the Canaanites, though they have chariots of iron, and though they are strong.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole congregation of the children of Israel assembled themselves together at Shiloh, and set up the Tent of Meeting there. The land was subdued before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven tribes remained among the children of Israel, which had not yet divided their inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said to the children of Israel, “How long will you neglect to go in to possess the land, which Yahweh, the God of your fathers, has given you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Appoint for yourselves three men from each tribe. I will send them, and they shall arise, walk through the land, and describe it according to their inheritance; then they shall come to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall divide it into seven portions. Judah shall live in his borders on the south, and the house of Joseph shall live in their borders on the north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall survey the land into seven parts, and bring the description here to me; and I will cast lots for you here before Yahweh our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, the Levites have no portion among you; for the priesthood of Yahweh is their inheritance. Gad, Reuben, and the half-tribe of Manasseh have received their inheritance east of the Jordan, which Moses the servant of Yahweh gave them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men arose and went. Joshua commanded those who went to survey the land, saying, “Go walk through the land, survey it, and come again to me. I will cast lots for you here before Yahweh in Shiloh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men went and passed through the land, and surveyed it by cities into seven portions in a book. They came to Joshua to the camp at Shiloh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua cast lots for them in Shiloh before Yahweh. There Joshua divided the land to the children of Israel according to their divisions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lot of the tribe of the children of Benjamin came up according to their families. The border of their lot went out between the children of Judah and the children of Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their border on the north quarter was from the Jordan. The border went up to the side of Jericho on the north, and went up through the hill country westward. It ended at the wilderness of Beth Aven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border passed along from there to Luz, to the side of Luz (also called Bethel), southward. The border went down to Ataroth Addar, by the mountain that lies on the south of Beth Horon the lower.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border extended, and turned around on the west quarter southward, from the mountain that lies before Beth Horon southward; and ended at Kiriath Baal (also called Kiriath Jearim), a city of the children of Judah. This was the west quarter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The south quarter was from the farthest part of Kiriath Jearim. The border went out westward, and went out to the spring of the waters of Nephtoah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border went down to the farthest part of the mountain that lies before the valley of the son of Hinnom, which is in the valley of Rephaim northward. It went down to the valley of Hinnom, to the side of the Jebusite southward, and went down to En Rogel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It extended northward, went out at En Shemesh, and went out to Geliloth, which is opposite the ascent of Adummim. It went down to the stone of Bohan the son of Reuben.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It passed along to the side opposite the Arabah northward, and went down to the Arabah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border passed along to the side of Beth Hoglah northward; and the border ended at the north bay of the Salt Sea, at the south end of the Jordan. This was the south border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jordan was its border on the east quarter. This was the inheritance of the children of Benjamin, by the borders around it, according to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the cities of the tribe of the children of Benjamin according to their families were Jericho, Beth Hoglah, Emek Keziz,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beth Arabah, Zemaraim, Bethel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Avvim, Parah, Ophrah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Chephar Ammoni, Ophni, and Geba; twelve cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gibeon, Ramah, Beeroth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mizpeh, Chephirah, Mozah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rekem, Irpeel, Taralah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zelah, Eleph, the Jebusite (also called Jerusalem), Gibeath, and Kiriath; fourteen cities with their villages. This is the inheritance of the children of Benjamin according to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second lot came out for Simeon, even for the tribe of the children of Simeon according to their families. Their inheritance was in the middle of the inheritance of the children of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had for their inheritance Beersheba (or Sheba), Moladah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hazar Shual, Balah, Ezem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eltolad, Bethul, Hormah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ziklag, Beth Marcaboth, Hazar Susah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beth Lebaoth, and Sharuhen; thirteen cities with their villages;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ain, Rimmon, Ether, and Ashan; four cities with their villages;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the villages that were around these cities to Baalath Beer, Ramah of the South. This is the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Simeon according to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of the part of the children of Judah was the inheritance of the children of Simeon; for the portion of the children of Judah was too much for them. Therefore the children of Simeon had inheritance in the middle of their inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The third lot came up for the children of Zebulun according to their families. The border of their inheritance was to Sarid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their border went up westward, even to Maralah, and reached to Dabbesheth. It reached to the brook that is before Jokneam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It turned from Sarid eastward toward the sunrise to the border of Chisloth Tabor. It went out to Daberath, and went up to Japhia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there it passed along eastward to Gath Hepher, to Ethkazin; and it went out at Rimmon which stretches to Neah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border turned around it on the north to Hannathon; and it ended at the valley of Iphtah El;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kattath, Nahalal, Shimron, Idalah, and Bethlehem: twelve cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the inheritance of the children of Zebulun according to their families, these cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fourth lot came out for Issachar, even for the children of Issachar according to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their border was to Jezreel, Chesulloth, Shunem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hapharaim, Shion, Anaharath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rabbith, Kishion, Ebez,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remeth, Engannim, En Haddah, and Beth Pazzez.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border reached to Tabor, Shahazumah, and Beth Shemesh. Their border ended at the Jordan: sixteen cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Issachar according to their families, the cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fifth lot came out for the tribe of the children of Asher according to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their border was Helkath, Hali, Beten, Achshaph,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Allammelech, Amad, Mishal. It reached to Carmel westward, and to Shihorlibnath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It turned toward the sunrise to Beth Dagon, and reached to Zebulun, and to the valley of Iphtah El northward to Beth Emek and Neiel. It went out to Cabul on the left hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Ebron, Rehob, Hammon, and Kanah, even to great Sidon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border turned to Ramah, to the fortified city of Tyre; and the border turned to Hosah. It ended at the sea by the region of Achzib;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ummah also, and Aphek, and Rehob: twenty-two cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Asher according to their families, these cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sixth lot came out for the children of Naphtali, even for the children of Naphtali according to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their border was from Heleph, from the oak in Zaanannim, Adami-nekeb, and Jabneel, to Lakkum. It ended at the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border turned westward to Aznoth Tabor, and went out from there to Hukkok. It reached to Zebulun on the south, and reached to Asher on the west, and to Judah at the Jordan toward the sunrise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fortified cities were Ziddim, Zer, Hammath, Rakkath, Chinnereth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Adamah, Ramah, Hazor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kedesh, Edrei, En Hazor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Iron, Migdal El, Horem, Beth Anath, and Beth Shemesh; nineteen cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Naphtali according to their families, the cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventh lot came out for the tribe of the children of Dan according to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border of their inheritance was Zorah, Eshtaol, Irshemesh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shaalabbin, Aijalon, Ithlah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elon, Timnah, Ekron,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eltekeh, Gibbethon, Baalath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehud, Bene Berak, Gath Rimmon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Me Jarkon, and Rakkon, with the border opposite Joppa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border of the children of Dan went out beyond them; for the children of Dan went up and fought against Leshem, and took it, and struck it with the edge of the sword, and possessed it, and lived therein, and called Leshem, Dan, after the name of Dan their forefather.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Dan according to their families, these cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they finished distributing the land for inheritance by its borders. The children of Israel gave an inheritance to Joshua the son of Nun among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to Yahweh’s commandment, they gave him the city which he asked, even Timnathserah in the hill country of Ephraim; and he built the city, and lived there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the inheritances, which Eleazar the priest, Joshua the son of Nun, and the heads of the fathers’ houses of the tribes of the children of Israel, distributed for inheritance by lot in Shiloh before Yahweh, at the door of the Tent of Meeting. So they finished dividing the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Joshua, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the children of Israel, saying, ‘Assign the cities of refuge, of which I spoke to you by Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the man slayer who kills any person accidentally or unintentionally may flee there. They shall be to you for a refuge from the avenger of blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall flee to one of those cities, and shall stand at the entrance of the gate of the city, and declare his case in the ears of the elders of that city. They shall take him into the city with them, and give him a place, that he may live among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the avenger of blood pursues him, then they shall not deliver up the man slayer into his hand; because he struck his neighbor unintentionally, and didn’t hate him before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall dwell in that city until he stands before the congregation for judgment, until the death of the high priest that shall be in those days. Then the man slayer shall return, and come to his own city, and to his own house, to the city he fled from.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set apart Kedesh in Galilee in the hill country of Naphtali, Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim, and Kiriath Arba (also called Hebron) in the hill country of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beyond the Jordan at Jericho eastward, they assigned Bezer in the wilderness in the plain out of the tribe of Reuben, Ramoth in Gilead out of the tribe of Gad, and Golan in Bashan out of the tribe of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the appointed cities for all the children of Israel, and for the alien who lives among them, that whoever kills any person unintentionally might flee there, and not die by the hand of the avenger of blood, until he stands trial before the congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the heads of fathers’ houses of the Levites came near to Eleazar the priest, and to Joshua the son of Nun, and to the heads of fathers’ houses of the tribes of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They spoke to them at Shiloh in the land of Canaan, saying, “Yahweh commanded through Moses to give us cities to dwell in, with their pasture lands for our livestock.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel gave to the Levites out of their inheritance, according to the commandment of Yahweh, these cities with their pasture lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lot came out for the families of the Kohathites. The children of Aaron the priest, who were of the Levites, had thirteen cities by lot out of the tribe of Judah, out of the tribe of the Simeonites, and out of the tribe of Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest of the children of Kohath had ten cities by lot out of the families of the tribe of Ephraim, out of the tribe of Dan, and out of the half-tribe of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Gershon had thirteen cities by lot out of the families of the tribe of Issachar, out of the tribe of Asher, out of the tribe of Naphtali, and out of the half-tribe of Manasseh in Bashan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Merari according to their families had twelve cities out of the tribe of Reuben, out of the tribe of Gad, and out of the tribe of Zebulun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel gave these cities with their pasture lands by lot to the Levites, as Yahweh commanded by Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They gave out of the tribe of the children of Judah, and out of the tribe of the children of Simeon, these cities which are mentioned by name:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were for the children of Aaron, of the families of the Kohathites, who were of the children of Levi; for theirs was the first lot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They gave them Kiriath Arba, named after the father of Anak (also called Hebron), in the hill country of Judah, with its pasture lands around it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they gave the fields of the city and its villages to Caleb the son of Jephunneh for his possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the children of Aaron the priest they gave Hebron with its pasture lands, the city of refuge for the man slayer, Libnah with its pasture lands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jattir with its pasture lands, Eshtemoa with its pasture lands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Holon with its pasture lands, Debir with its pasture lands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ain with its pasture lands, Juttah with its pasture lands, and Beth Shemesh with its pasture lands: nine cities out of those two tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of the tribe of Benjamin, Gibeon with its pasture lands, Geba with its pasture lands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anathoth with its pasture lands, and Almon with its pasture lands: four cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the cities of the children of Aaron, the priests, were thirteen cities with their pasture lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The families of the children of Kohath, the Levites, even the rest of the children of Kohath, had the cities of their lot out of the tribe of Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They gave them Shechem with its pasture lands in the hill country of Ephraim, the city of refuge for the man slayer, and Gezer with its pasture lands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kibzaim with its pasture lands, and Beth Horon with its pasture lands: four cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of the tribe of Dan, Elteke with its pasture lands, Gibbethon with its pasture lands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aijalon with its pasture lands, Gath Rimmon with its pasture lands: four cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of the half-tribe of Manasseh, Taanach with its pasture lands, and Gath Rimmon with its pasture lands: two cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the cities of the families of the rest of the children of Kohath were ten with their pasture lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They gave to the children of Gershon, of the families of the Levites, out of the half-tribe of Manasseh Golan in Bashan with its pasture lands, the city of refuge for the man slayer, and Be Eshterah with its pasture lands: two cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of the tribe of Issachar, Kishion with its pasture lands, Daberath with its pasture lands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jarmuth with its pasture lands, En Gannim with its pasture lands: four cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of the tribe of Asher, Mishal with its pasture lands, Abdon with its pasture lands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Helkath with its pasture lands, and Rehob with its pasture lands: four cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of the tribe of Naphtali, Kedesh in Galilee with its pasture lands, the city of refuge for the man slayer, Hammothdor with its pasture lands, and Kartan with its pasture lands: three cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the cities of the Gershonites according to their families were thirteen cities with their pasture lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the families of the children of Merari, the rest of the Levites, out of the tribe of Zebulun, Jokneam with its pasture lands, Kartah with its pasture lands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dimnah with its pasture lands, and Nahalal with its pasture lands: four cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of the tribe of Reuben, Bezer with its pasture lands, Jahaz with its pasture lands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kedemoth with its pasture lands, and Mephaath with its pasture lands: four cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of the tribe of Gad, Ramoth in Gilead with its pasture lands, the city of refuge for the man slayer, and Mahanaim with its pasture lands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heshbon with its pasture lands, Jazer with its pasture lands: four cities in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were the cities of the children of Merari according to their families, even the rest of the families of the Levites. Their lot was twelve cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the cities of the Levites among the possessions of the children of Israel were forty-eight cities with their pasture lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each of these cities included their pasture lands around them. It was this way with all these cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Yahweh gave to Israel all the land which he swore to give to their fathers. They possessed it, and lived in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh gave them rest all around, according to all that he swore to their fathers. Not a man of all their enemies stood before them. Yahweh delivered all their enemies into their hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nothing failed of any good thing which Yahweh had spoken to the house of Israel. All came to pass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua called the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to them, “You have kept all that Moses the servant of Yahweh commanded you, and have listened to my voice in all that I commanded you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have not left your brothers these many days to this day, but have performed the duty of the commandment of Yahweh your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Yahweh your God has given rest to your brothers, as he spoke to them. Therefore now return and go to your tents, to the land of your possession, which Moses the servant of Yahweh gave you beyond the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only take diligent heed to do the commandment and the law which Moses the servant of Yahweh commanded you, to love Yahweh your God, to walk in all his ways, to keep his commandments, to hold fast to him, and to serve him with all your heart and with all your soul.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua blessed them, and sent them away; and they went to their tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now to the one half-tribe of Manasseh Moses had given inheritance in Bashan; but Joshua gave to the other half among their brothers beyond the Jordan westward. Moreover when Joshua sent them away to their tents, he blessed them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and spoke to them, saying, “Return with much wealth to your tents, with very much livestock, with silver, with gold, with bronze, with iron, and with very much clothing. Divide the plunder of your enemies with your brothers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh returned, and departed from the children of Israel out of Shiloh, which is in the land of Canaan, to go to the land of Gilead, to the land of their possession, which they owned, according to the commandment of Yahweh by Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to the region near the Jordan, that is in the land of Canaan, the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh built an altar there by the Jordan, a great altar to look at.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel heard this, “Behold, the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh have built an altar along the border of the land of Canaan, in the region around the Jordan, on the side that belongs to the children of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the children of Israel heard of it, the whole congregation of the children of Israel gathered themselves together at Shiloh, to go up against them to war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel sent to the children of Reuben, and to the children of Gad, and to the half-tribe of Manasseh, into the land of Gilead, Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With him were ten princes, one prince of a fathers’ house for each of the tribes of Israel; and they were each head of their fathers’ houses among the thousands of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to the children of Reuben, and to the children of Gad, and to the half-tribe of Manasseh, to the land of Gilead, and they spoke with them, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The whole congregation of Yahweh says, ‘What trespass is this that you have committed against the God of Israel, to turn away today from following Yahweh, in that you have built yourselves an altar, to rebel today against Yahweh?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is the iniquity of Peor too little for us, from which we have not cleansed ourselves to this day, although there came a plague on the congregation of Yahweh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you must turn away today from following Yahweh? It will be, since you rebel today against Yahweh, that tomorrow he will be angry with the whole congregation of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, if the land of your possession is unclean, then pass over to the land of the possession of Yahweh, in which Yahweh’s tabernacle dwells, and take possession among us; but don’t rebel against Yahweh, nor rebel against us, in building an altar other than Yahweh our God’s altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Didn’t Achan the son of Zerah commit a trespass in the devoted thing, and wrath fell on all the congregation of Israel? That man didn’t perish alone in his iniquity.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh answered, and spoke to the heads of the thousands of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Mighty One, God, Yahweh, the Mighty One, God, Yahweh, he knows; and Israel shall know: if it was in rebellion, or if in trespass against Yahweh (don’t save us today),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that we have built us an altar to turn away from following Yahweh; or if to offer burnt offering or meal offering, or if to offer sacrifices of peace offerings, let Yahweh himself require it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If we have not out of concern done this, and for a reason, saying, ‘In time to come your children might speak to our children, saying, “What have you to do with Yahweh, the God of Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Yahweh has made the Jordan a border between us and you, you children of Reuben and children of Gad. You have no portion in Yahweh.”’ So your children might make our children cease from fearing Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore we said, ‘Let’s now prepare to build ourselves an altar, not for burnt offering, nor for sacrifice;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but it will be a witness between us and you, and between our generations after us, that we may perform the service of Yahweh before him with our burnt offerings, with our sacrifices, and with our peace offerings;’ that your children may not tell our children in time to come, ‘You have no portion in Yahweh.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore we said, ‘It shall be, when they tell us or our generations this in time to come, that we shall say, “Behold the pattern of Yahweh’s altar, which our fathers made, not for burnt offering, nor for sacrifice; but it is a witness between us and you.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Far be it from us that we should rebel against Yahweh, and turn away today from following Yahweh, to build an altar for burnt offering, for meal offering, or for sacrifice, besides Yahweh our God’s altar that is before his tabernacle!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Phinehas the priest, and the princes of the congregation, even the heads of the thousands of Israel that were with him, heard the words that the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the children of Manasseh spoke, it pleased them well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest said to the children of Reuben, to the children of Gad, and to the children of Manasseh, “Today we know that Yahweh is among us, because you have not committed this trespass against Yahweh. Now you have delivered the children of Israel out of Yahweh’s hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest, and the princes, returned from the children of Reuben, and from the children of Gad, out of the land of Gilead, to the land of Canaan, to the children of Israel, and brought them word again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The thing pleased the children of Israel; and the children of Israel blessed God, and spoke no more of going up against them to war, to destroy the land in which the children of Reuben and the children of Gad lived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Reuben and the children of Gad named the altar “A Witness Between Us that Yahweh is God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After many days, when Yahweh had given rest to Israel from their enemies all around, and Joshua was old and well advanced in years,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua called for all Israel, for their elders and for their heads, and for their judges and for their officers, and said to them, “I am old and well advanced in years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have seen all that Yahweh your God has done to all these nations because of you; for it is Yahweh your God who has fought for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I have allotted to you these nations that remain, to be an inheritance for your tribes, from the Jordan, with all the nations that I have cut off, even to the great sea toward the going down of the sun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh your God will thrust them out from before you, and drive them from out of your sight. You shall possess their land, as Yahweh your God spoke to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore be very courageous to keep and to do all that is written in the book of the law of Moses, that you not turn away from it to the right hand or to the left;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you not come among these nations, these that remain among you; neither make mention of the name of their gods, nor cause to swear by them, neither serve them, nor bow down yourselves to them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but hold fast to Yahweh your God, as you have done to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For Yahweh has driven great and strong nations out from before you. But as for you, no man has stood before you to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One man of you shall chase a thousand; for it is Yahweh your God who fights for you, as he spoke to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take good heed therefore to yourselves, that you love Yahweh your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if you do at all go back, and hold fast to the remnant of these nations, even these who remain among you, and make marriages with them, and go in to them, and they to you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: know for a certainty that Yahweh your God will no longer drive these nations from out of your sight; but they shall be a snare and a trap to you, a scourge in your sides, and thorns in your eyes, until you perish from off this good land which Yahweh your God has given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, today I am going the way of all the earth. You know in all your hearts and in all your souls that not one thing has failed of all the good things which Yahweh your God spoke concerning you. All have happened to you. Not one thing has failed of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall happen that as all the good things have come on you of which Yahweh your God spoke to you, so Yahweh will bring on you all the evil things, until he has destroyed you from off this good land which Yahweh your God has given you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when you disobey the covenant of Yahweh your God, which he commanded you, and go and serve other gods, and bow down yourselves to them. Then Yahweh’s anger will be kindled against you, and you will perish quickly from off the good land which he has given to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua gathered all the tribes of Israel to Shechem, and called for the elders of Israel, for their heads, for their judges, and for their officers; and they presented themselves before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said to all the people, “Yahweh, the God of Israel, says, ‘Your fathers lived of old time beyond the River, even Terah, the father of Abraham, and the father of Nahor. They served other gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I took your father Abraham from beyond the River, and led him throughout all the land of Canaan, and multiplied his offspring, and gave him Isaac.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gave to Isaac Jacob and Esau: and I gave to Esau Mount Seir, to possess it. Jacob and his children went down into Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘I sent Moses and Aaron, and I plagued Egypt, according to that which I did among them: and afterward I brought you out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I brought your fathers out of Egypt: and you came to the sea. The Egyptians pursued your fathers with chariots and with horsemen to the Red Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they cried out to Yahweh, he put darkness between you and the Egyptians, and brought the sea on them, and covered them; and your eyes saw what I did in Egypt. You lived in the wilderness many days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘I brought you into the land of the Amorites, that lived beyond the Jordan. They fought with you, and I gave them into your hand. You possessed their land, and I destroyed them from before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balak the son of Zippor, king of Moab, arose and fought against Israel. He sent and called Balaam the son of Beor to curse you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I would not listen to Balaam; therefore he blessed you still. So I delivered you out of his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘You went over the Jordan, and came to Jericho. The men of Jericho fought against you, the Amorite, the Perizzite, the Canaanite, the Hittite, the Girgashite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite; and I delivered them into your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I sent the hornet before you, which drove them out from before you, even the two kings of the Amorites; not with your sword, nor with your bow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gave you a land on which you had not labored, and cities which you didn’t build, and you live in them. You eat of vineyards and olive groves which you didn’t plant.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now therefore fear Yahweh, and serve him in sincerity and in truth. Put away the gods which your fathers served beyond the River, in Egypt; and serve Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it seems evil to you to serve Yahweh, choose today whom you will serve; whether the gods which your fathers served that were beyond the River, or the gods of the Amorites, in whose land you dwell; but as for me and my house, we will serve Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people answered, “Far be it from us that we should forsake Yahweh, to serve other gods;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for it is Yahweh our God who brought us and our fathers up out of the land of Egypt, from the house of bondage, and who did those great signs in our sight, and preserved us in all the way in which we went, and among all the peoples through the middle of whom we passed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh drove out from before us all the peoples, even the Amorites who lived in the land. Therefore we also will serve Yahweh; for he is our God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said to the people, “You can’t serve Yahweh, for he is a holy God. He is a jealous God. He will not forgive your disobedience nor your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you forsake Yahweh, and serve foreign gods, then he will turn and do you evil, and consume you, after he has done you good.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people said to Joshua, “No, but we will serve Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Joshua said to the people, “You are witnesses against yourselves that you have chosen Yahweh yourselves, to serve him.”
They said, “We are witnesses.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now therefore put away the foreign gods which are among you, and incline your heart to Yahweh, the God of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people said to Joshua, “We will serve Yahweh our God, and we will listen to his voice.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua made a covenant with the people that day, and made for them a statute and an ordinance in Shechem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua wrote these words in the book of the law of God; and he took a great stone, and set it up there under the oak that was by the sanctuary of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said to all the people, “Behold, this stone shall be a witness against us, for it has heard all Yahweh’s words which he spoke to us. It shall be therefore a witness against you, lest you deny your God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua sent the people away, each to his own inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things, Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of Yahweh, died, being one hundred ten years old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They buried him in the border of his inheritance in Timnathserah, which is in the hill country of Ephraim, on the north of the mountain of Gaash.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel served Yahweh all the days of Joshua, and all the days of the elders who outlived Joshua, and had known all the work of Yahweh, that he had worked for Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They buried the bones of Joseph, which the children of Israel brought up out of Egypt, in Shechem, in the parcel of ground which Jacob bought from the sons of Hamor the father of Shechem for a hundred pieces of silver. They became the inheritance of the children of Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eleazar the son of Aaron died. They buried him in the hill of Phinehas his son, which was given him in the hill country of Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator
